channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024010670

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought back to the station wet and leaking. Package was placed in a hazmat bag in a a hazmat tote DescribePack: Content had a loose cap which caused damage to the content DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To mitigate the results, the package was place in a hazmat bag and hazmat tote

item.title: Report X-2024010654
item.description:
Report X-2024010654

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: WINDSOR
  • State: CA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat pkg was found at the end of trailer 561866 on its side unsecured and wet around 12:30am. Hazmat pkg was place in a line tote. QA was notify about the hazmat pkg and brought to the Hazmat cage for process. DescribePack: Upon inspection one out of the four bottles of Aqua balance muriatic acid cap was loose and spilled. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Damage hazmat was place in a line tote and brought to Hazmat cage for process.

item.title: Report X-2024010667
item.description:
Report X-2024010667

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Packages were loaded in the morning for delivery. Driver was unable to deliver because one of the hazmat packages started leaking and damaged 2 other hazmat packages. DescribePack: One of the 1 GAL containers had a loose cap and spilled internally. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a red hazmat tote that was lined with hazmat bag to mitigate any further release.

item.title: Report E-2024010456
item.description:
Report E-2024010456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USD experienced a UN2031 Nitric Acid release from a 55-gallon steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to clean the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-ounces of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the drum lid due to loose bung caps. Contractors tightened the bungs and secured the drums for shipment on. The drum was wiped down and neutralized with sodium bicarb. The damaged impacted rags and PPE were collected and containerized into a 20-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Description: 1 quart of "ZEP CLOG ATTACK" from one 1gal poly jug which was punctured by a forklift during loading. No Drains, Soils, or Waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024010471
item.description:
Report E-2024010471

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that a very small amount of UM Barr Klean-Strip Acetone (UN1090) was released from a cardboard box containing approximately 4 metal 1-gallon containers of product due to a forklift accident. The release impacted just the cardboard box it was shipped in. Terminal personnel cleaned up the spill using appropriate PPE provided by the terminal per the SDS. (they advised no absorbent was used - the small amount of liquid on the box evaporated/dried). 1 box- Containing cardboard box and (4) 1-gallon metal containers was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

Report X-2024010525

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RECEIVED A CALL FOR LEAKING PACKAGE FROM AN IRREG BELT. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT LOCATION WITH PROPER PPE, FOUND A WET HAZMAT PLASATIC CONTAINER ON THE BELT. RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL FOLLOWING DECISION TREE/APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. BROUGHT CONTAINER BACK TO DMP AREA FOR FINAL PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023121084
item.description:
Report X-2023121084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-25
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The sample line valve had a liquid leak from the plug treads. The valve was open and plug was tool tight but did not create a seal. The valve was closed and plug was removed, new Teflon tape applied and then reinstalled, this stopped the release.

item.title: Report X-2024010634
item.description:
Report X-2024010634

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024010622
item.description:
Report X-2024010622

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE PREVIOUSLY DPR'D AND WASTE PRODUCTS SENT TO HMSA. GOODS FOUND TO BE REGULATED. SPIDR INDICATES THAT NO MARKINGS WERE ON OUTER CARTON. PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET, DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION. VERY MINIMAL INTERNAL PACKAGING. NO PAINT CLIPS FOUND. DescribePack: BOTH CANS OF PAINT WITH DENTED BODIES AND LIDS OFF. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report I-2024100051
item.description:
Report I-2024100051

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Fifteen minutes after departing from BOS, the customer observed their crossbody bag that they were wearing smelled strongly of the e-cigarette juice. Upon opening the zipper compartment holding the e-cigarette he saw the blue light on and was unable to switch it off. The customer immediately notified a Flight Attendant to assist with the situation. The Purser obtained the e-cigarette and utilized the fire containment bag. The crew maintained custody of the containment bag until arrival in LAX when it was tendered to the CSM who met the flight.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOTTOM SIDE OF BOX SHOWED IMPACT MARK, INNER JERRICAN LEAKED. PUT IN PLASTIC BAG INSIDE OF TOTE DescribePack: BOTTOM OF BOX SATURATED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ABSORBENT AND PLASTIC BAG

item.title: Report X-2024010618
item.description:
Report X-2024010618

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found strapped onto 2 other hazmat's but only one box showed signs of leakage. It was underneath the NC rollers by the trailer door and was picked up with a red hazardous bin. DescribePack: The top flap of the box had a wet mark near where the cap of the bottle was located. Upon inner inspection the cap was found loose and the inner part of the top flaps was also wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spillage was not major and only the absorbent inside the red hazardous bin was used.

item.title: Report X-2023121083
item.description:
Report X-2023121083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-25
  • City: Roseville
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The sample line valve had a vapor leak at the valve plug, valve was in the closed position and plug was tool tight and did not create a seal. The valve is defective (seized) and leaking. The plug was removed, new Teflon tape was applied, and the plug was reinstalled. The valve at secondary securement is no longer leaking.
